meanings.definition: To value or estimate too highly
meanings.sent1: She overprized her old toy, thinking it was a rare treasure.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overprize his own abilities, which can lead to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The cat overprized the simple cardboard box, ignoring the expensive cat bed.
meanings.sent4: Her overprized opinion of herself made it difficult for others to connect with her.
meanings.sent5: The overprized painting turned out to be a cheap replica.

meanings.sent1: The overprized shoes were out of reach for most customers.
meanings.sent2: The overprized concert tickets left many fans disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The overprized dessert at the restaurant was just a simple cookie with a fancy name.
meanings.sent4: Her overprized jewelry collection was actually made of fake gems.
meanings.sent5: The overprized car looked impressive but had many hidden issues.
